extensionDescription.message: Detects web page compatibility issues. Initiated by Google Chrome Team.

normalTitleText.message: Click to start detecting compatibility issues on this page

warningTitleText.message:
Some warning level compatiblility issues are found.
Click to view.

errorTitleText.message:
Some error level compatiblility issues are found.
Click to view.

popup_loading.message: Waiting for page to finish loading...

popup_checkboxEffectTip.message: Tips: click the checkbox to toggle corresponding annotations on the page.

bd_strangeDTD.message: This DTD is not frequently used.

bd_makeIEBeInQuirksMode.message: There are comments or XML header before the DTD in this page, which will turn the page into quirks mode in IE.

bd_sameDTD.message: IE and Chrome will use $1 rendering mode, which is $2.

bd_reducePossibility.message: to reduce the possibility of triggering a compatibility issue.

bd_inQuirksMode.message: It is better to use a DTD that makes the page rendered in stardards mode,

bd_differentDTD.message: IE and Chrome will render in $1, it is better to change the DTD,

bd_noDTD.message: There is no DTD on this page, and it will be rendered in $1 in all browsers. It is better to use a DTD that makes the page rendered in stardards mode,

bd_nodeCount.message: There are $1 DOM nodes in this page.

bd_styleTotalCount.message: There are $1 STYLE nodes in this page

bd_styleNotInHeadCount.message: ($1 not put inside the HEAD tag).

bd_noStyle.message: There is no STYLE node in this page.

bd_linkTotalCount.message: There are $1 LINK nodes in this page

bd_linkNotInHeadCount.message: ($1 not put inside the HEAD tag).

bd_noLink.message: There is no LINK node in this page.

bd_IECondCommCount.message: There are $1 conditional comments in this page, which is only supported by IE.

bd_hasDeprecatedTag.message: There is deprecated tag $1 in this page, it should not be used any more.

bd_noDeprecatedTag.message: This page does not use any deprecated tags.

bd_hasDeprecatedAttribute.message: There is deprecated attribute $1 in tag  $2, it should not be used any more.

bd_noDeprecatedAttribute.message: This page does not use any deprecated attributes.

KB001.message: Compatibility issues and browser's rendering engine and rendering mode

BT1025.message: IE will ignore the trailing full shaped whitespaces in elements which trigger 'hasLayout'

BT1025_suggestion.message: Avoid using full shaped whitespaces, use ' ' instead.

BT9005.message: VBScript is only supported by IE

BT9005_suggestion.message: Don't use VBScript. Use JavaScript instead.

BT9006.message: JScript.Encode is only supported by IE

BT9006_suggestion.message: Don't use IE only features for scripting

BX1030.message: IE8(S) Firefox Opera Chrome Safari will refer to child element's width when calculating MARQUEE's width in some conditions

BX1030_suggestion.message: Alwarys explicitly specify the width for MARQUEE elements.

BX9002.message: document.all is not supported by all browsers

BX9002_suggestion.message: Do not use document.all. Use document.getElementById, document.getElementsByTagName, which is already standardized in W3C DOM specification.

BX9021.message: IE6 IE7 IE8 extend the onreadystatechange event

BX9021_suggestion.message: In W3C stardards, only XmlHttpRequest object has onreadystatechange event  (refer to XMLHttpRequest specification).

HA8001.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), the CENTER element will make elements aligned to center. But in IE(S) Opera(S), text in tables will also be centered. (TODO: clarify)

HA8001_suggestion.message: Do not use CENTER tag. Use CSS's 'text-align' instead.

HF3005.message: "disabled" attribute can be used on non-form elements in  IE6 IE7 IE8

HF3005_suggestion.message: Avoid using "disabled" attribute on non-form elements

HF3013.message: IE6 IE7 do not support disabled attribute for OPTION and OPTGROUP tags

HF3013_suggestion.message: Use other ways to make OPTION and OPTGROUP disabled, such as removing those elements by script

HY1005.message: IE6 IE7 IE8(Q) treat non list elments inside UL, OL, DL differently

HY1005_suggestion.message: It is not recommended to use other elements inside LI, DD, DT

RE1012.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q) Firefox(Q) Opera(Q), empty table cells may not have borders in some situation

RE1012_suggestion.message: Avoid empty table cells, fill them with

RE1013.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), the 'padding' style for cells to the top and bottom of an empty cell is not effective

RE1013_suggestion.message: Avoid empty table cells, fill them with

RE1020.message: IE6 IE7 IE8(Q) do not support 'border-spacing'

RE1020_suggestion.message: 'border-spacing' is not supported by all browsers.  TABLE's cellspacing can be used if border-spacings are equal for all edges.

RX1008.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), cellspacing attribute will be effective for TABLE with collapsed borders (TODO: verify)

RX1008_suggestion.message: When using border-collapse:collapse, make sure that TABLE's cellspacing is 0.

RE8014.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), TABLE cells are aligned by element's original width, instead of the actual width which may be stretched by some reason.

RE8014_suggestion.message: Do not specify width for both TABLE and columns in it. If each column's width is set, TABLE's width should use the default value("auto"). If TABLE's width is set, at least one column's width should be "auto".

RM8015.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), new layers will be created for positioned elements with default 'z-index' value in some situation. (TODO: verify)

RM8015_suggestion.message: Understand the relationship between layers and 'z-index'. (TODO: verify)

RT3002.message: 'text-decoration' is not rendered in the same way for elements and their descendant in all browsers

RT3002_suggestion.message: Use a reasonable solution according to the specific needs. (TODO: verify)

RT3005_suggestion.message: Do not use 'text-overflow:ellipsis' for block elements

RT8003.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), 'text-align' will be applied to block elements, and for quirks mode in all browsers, it can not be inherited by TABLE element

RT8003_suggestion.message: Avoid using 'text-align' for child block or TABLE elements that has a smaller width.

RV1001.message: In IE, when 'overflow-x' or 'overflow-y' is not set to 'visible', the computed value for the other is 'visible', not 'auto'

RV1001_suggestion.message: set both 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y', do not use 'hidden' and 'visible' together

RX1003.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), 'white-space' is not inherited in some situations

RX1003_suggestion.message: Specify 'white-space' for TD and its child elements. Do not let TD inherite its parent's 'white-space'. Or avoid set width and white-space:nowrap / nowrap for TD elements

RX3011.message: FONT element's color will be applied to its parent's decoration color in some situations.

RX3011_suggestion.message: FONT is deprecated, and should not be used any more.

RX8004.message: In non-IE browsers, TABLE's 'margin' will affect TABLE's align attribute

RX8004_suggestion.message: Since align attribute is deprecated for TABLE, use CSS instead

RX8015.message: In IE6 IE7 IE8(Q), align='left|right' is not treated correctly for IMG, OBJECT, IFRAME, TABLE elements

RX8015_suggestion.message: align attribute is deprecated. Use CSS 'float' instead for IMG, OBJECT, IFRAME, TABLE, APPLET, EMBED elements.

RX8017.message: IE renders 'shrink-to-fit' incorrectly for floating non-replaced elements which have percent width

RX8017_suggestion.message: Specify width for floating element explicitly.

SD9012.message: IE6 IE7 IE8 do not match in case sensitive way for getElementsByName method

SD9012_suggestion.message: Always use the exactly same text for element's ID and string constant in scripts.

HO9006.message: Firefox and Opera do not support the using of Windows Media Player or Flash by specifying classid for OBJECT element

HO9006_suggestion.message: Do not use classid for OBJECT.
